gmd:title.gmx:Anchor: Barbados-Bermuda Th-232,230 from the U.S. GEOTRACES NAT project of the U.S. GEOTRACES program

gmd:abstract.gco:CharacterString: Seawater concentrations of dissolved and total Th-232 and Th-230, Barbados to Bermuda Dataset Description: <p>This data was collected as part of a Chief Scientist Training Cruise, May-June 2014. The focus of this&nbsp;research was&nbsp;'Tracking Saharan dust deposition in the Northwest Atlantic using Th isotopes'. This data is&nbsp;GEOTRACES-compliant.</p> Acquisition Description: <p>Water sampling followed GEOTRACES protocols from a standard Niskin Bottle CTD/Rosette (Anderson et al. 2012). 4-5 L water samples were drained or filtered directly from Niskin bottles using Teflon-lined tygon tubing, acidified at sea with ultra-pure 6 molar hydrochloric acid, and analyzed at on-shore at MIT. Analysis involved Fe hydroxide co-precipitation, acid digestion, anion exchange chromatography and isotope dilution inductively-coupled plasma mass spectrometry. Laboratory methods were slightly modified from Anderson et al. (2012) as described by Hayes et al (2015).</p><p><strong>References:</strong></p><p>Anderson, R. F., M. Q. Fleisher, L. F. Robinson, R. L. Edwards, J. Hoff, S. B. Moran, M. M. Rutgers van der Loeff, A. L. Thomas, M. Roy-Barman, and R. Franois (2012), GEOTRACES intercalibration of <sup>230</sup>Th, <sup>232</sup>Th, <sup>231</sup>Pa, and prospects for <sup>10</sup>Be, <em>Limnol. Oceanogr. Methods</em>, <em>10</em>, 179-213.</p><p>Hayes, C. T., R. F. Anderson, S. L. Jaccard, R. François, M. Q. Fleisher, M. Soon, and R. Gersonde (2013), A new perspective on boundary scavenging in the North Pacific Ocean, <em>Earth Planet. Sci. Lett.</em>, <em>369-370</em>(0), 86-97, doi:http://dx.doi.org/10.1016/j.epsl.2013.03.008.</p><div>Owens, S. A., K. O. Buesseler, and K. W. W. Sims. "Re-evaluating the 238 U-salinity relationship in seawater: implications for the 238 U-234 Th disequilibrium method." Marine Chemistry 127.1 (2011): 31-39.</div>

gmd:deliveryPoint.gco:CharacterString: Department of Marine Science 1020 Balch Boulevard

longitude at start time of measurement

Use Constraints: Please follow guidelines at: http://www.bco-dmo.org/terms-use Distribution liability: Under no circumstances shall BCO-DMO be liable for any direct, incidental, special, consequential, indirect, or punitive damages that result from the use of, or the inability to use, the materials in this data submission. If you are dissatisfied with any materials in this data submission your sole and exclusive remedy is to discontinue use.

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: GEOTRACES is a SCOR sponsored program; and funding for program infrastructure development is provided by the U.S. National Science Foundation.GEOTRACES gained momentum following a special symposium, S02: Biogeochemical cycling of trace elements and isotopes in the ocean and applications to constrain contemporary marine processes (GEOSECS II), at a 2003 Goldschmidt meeting convened in Japan. The GEOSECS II acronym referred to the Geochemical Ocean Section Studies To determine full water column distributions of selected trace elements and isotopes, including their concentration, chemical speciation, and physical form, along a sufficient number of sections in each ocean basin to establish the principal relationships between these distributions and with more traditional hydrographic parameters;* To evaluate the sources, sinks, and internal cycling of these species and thereby characterize more completely the physical, chemical and biological processes regulating their distributions, and the sensitivity of these processes to global change; and* To understand the processes that control the concentrations of geochemical species used for proxies of the past environment, both in the water column and in the substrates that reflect the water column.GEOTRACES will be global in scope, consisting of ocean sections complemented by regional process studies. Sections and process studies will combine fieldwork, laboratory experiments and modelling. Beyond realizing the scientific objectives identified above, a natural outcome of this work will be to build a community of marine scientists who understand the processes regulating trace element cycles sufficiently well to exploit this knowledge reliably in future interdisciplinary studies.

Alternative term PSALST02 is included to cover cases where there are two sensors of the same type contributing to the data set and referential integrity considerations prevent a usage of a single code. http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P01/current/ATTNZZ01/ Name: Attenuance (unspecified wavelength) per unit length of the water body by transmissometer Description: Red light unspecified path length transmissometer http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P01/current/CPHLPM01/ Name: Concentration of chlorophyll-a {chl-a} per unit volume of the water body [particulate phase] by in-situ chlorophyll fluorometer and manufacturer's calibration applied Description: In-situ fluorometer with manufacturer calibration applied. http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P03/current/C035/ Name: Metal and metalloid concentrations Description: Parameters pertaining to metal and trace metalloid (i.e. excluding Si) concentrations in any material. http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P03/current/C035/ Name: Metal and metalloid concentrations Description: Parameters pertaining to metal and trace metalloid (i.e. excluding Si) concentrations in any material. http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P03/current/C035/ Name: Metal and metalloid concentrations Description: Parameters pertaining to metal and trace metalloid (i.e. excluding Si) concentrations in any material. http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P03/current/C035/ Name: Metal and metalloid concentrations Description: Parameters pertaining to metal and trace metalloid (i.e. excluding Si) concentrations in any material. http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P03/current/C035/ Name: Metal and metalloid concentrations Description: Parameters pertaining to metal and trace metalloid (i.e. excluding Si) concentrations in any material. http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P01/current/ADATAA01/ Name: Date (UT as yyyymmdd) Description: Unavailable

gmd:descriptor.gco:CharacterString: PI-supplied Description: cruise identification; General Description: cruise designation; name
PI-supplied Description: station number; General Description: consecutive station number

PI-supplied Description: sample number derived from cast and bottle numbers; General Description: unique sample identification or number; any combination of alpha numeric characters; precise definition is file dependent NERC Description: Data record, event, sample or measurement reference numbers
PI-supplied Description: date at start of samping; General Description: date sampling starts such as YYYYMMDD

gmd:sequenceIdentifier.xlink:title: longitude at start time of measurement

gco:aName.gco:CharacterString: longitude at start time of measurement

gco:attributeType.xlink:title: Pressure (spatial co-ordinate) exerted by the water body by profiling pressure sensor and corrected to read zero at sea level

gmd:descriptor.gco:CharacterString: PI-supplied Description: pressure; General Description: water pressure at measurement; depth reported as pressure; positive number increasing with water depth NERC Description: The force per unit area exerted by the water column on a mobile sensor located in the water column.

PI-supplied Description: depth; General Description: observation/sample depth, in meters; best estimate; usually but not always calculated from pressure; calculated either from CTD pressure using Fofonoff and Millard (1982; UNESCO Tech Paper #44) algorithm adjusted for 1980 equation of state for seawater (EOS80) or simply equivalent to nominal depth as recorded during sampling if CTD pressure was unavailable NERC Description: The distance of a sensor or sampling point below the sea surface.

PI-supplied Description: temperature from CTD; General Description: water temperature at measurement depth NERC Description: The degree of hotness at any position within a volume of fresh or salt water expressed against the International Temperature Scale 1990 (ITS-90) calibration standard.

gco:attributeType.xlink:title: Practical salinity of the water body by CTD and computation using UNESCO 1983 algorithm

gmd:descriptor.gco:CharacterString: PI-supplied Description: salinity from CTD; General Description: salinity from the CTD when water bottle tripped; calculated from conductivity per the PSS-78 scale NERC Description: This is the preferred term for this definition. Alternative term PSALST02 is included to cover cases where there are two sensors of the same type contributing to the data set and referential integrity considerations prevent a usage of a single code.
PI-supplied Description: dissolved oxygen from CTD; General Description: dissolved oxygen; e.g. measurement from a high resolution CTD instrument

gco:attributeType.xlink:title: Attenuance (unspecified wavelength) per unit length of the water body by transmissometer

gmd:descriptor.gco:CharacterString: PI-supplied Description: Beam Attenuation Coefficient from the transmissometer; General Description: attenuation (loss of light) of a narrow, well collimated beam of light; beam attenuation due to particles; the particulate beam attenuation coefficient (cp) NERC Description: Red light unspecified path length transmissometer

gco:attributeType.xlink:title: Concentration of chlorophyll-a {chl-a} per unit volume of the water body [particulate phase] by in-situ chlorophyll fluorometer and manufacturer's calibration applied

gmd:descriptor.gco:CharacterString: PI-supplied Description: fluorescence; General Description: fluorescence; indirect measure of pigment concentration; possibly calibrated against extracted pigment concentrations; units may vary with dataset; for US JGOFS fluorescence as measured from CTD instrument sensor NERC Description: In-situ fluorometer with manufacturer calibration applied.

PI-supplied Description: Dissolved (<0.45 um) Th-230 concentration; General Description: Concentration of a trace metal in seawater. Refer to dataset for element name and units. NERC Description: Parameters pertaining to metal and trace metalloid (i.e. excluding Si) concentrations in any material.
PI-supplied Description: Dissolved (<0.45 um) Th-230 concentration error; General Description: Generic standard error taking on the dimensions of the parameter it is tied to.

gmd:organisationName.gmx:Anchor: Biological and Chemical Oceanography Data Management Office (BCO-DMO)

gmd:contactInstructions.gco:CharacterString: For questions regarding this resource, please contact BCO-DMO via the email address provided.

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: <p>Water sampling followed GEOTRACES protocols from a standard Niskin Bottle CTD/Rosette (Anderson et al. 2012). 4-5 L water samples were drained or filtered directly from Niskin bottles using Teflon-lined tygon tubing, acidified at sea with ultra-pure 6 molar hydrochloric acid, and analyzed at on-shore at MIT. Analysis involved Fe hydroxide co-precipitation, acid digestion, anion exchange chromatography and isotope dilution inductively-coupled plasma mass spectrometry. Laboratory methods were slightly modified from Anderson et al. (2012) as described by Hayes et al (2015).</p><p><strong>References:</strong></p><p>Anderson, R. F., M. Q. Fleisher, L. F. Robinson, R. L. Edwards, J. Hoff, S. B. Moran, M. M. Rutgers van der Loeff, A. L. Thomas, M. Roy-Barman, and R. Franois (2012), GEOTRACES intercalibration of <sup>230</sup>Th, <sup>232</sup>Th, <sup>231</sup>Pa, and prospects for <sup>10</sup>Be, <em>Limnol. Oceanogr. Methods</em>, <em>10</em>, 179-213.</p><p>Hayes, C. T., R. F. Anderson, S. L. Jaccard, R. François, M. Q. Fleisher, M. Soon, and R. Gersonde (2013), A new perspective on boundary scavenging in the North Pacific Ocean, <em>Earth Planet. Sci. Lett.</em>, <em>369-370</em>(0), 86-97, doi:http://dx.doi.org/10.1016/j.epsl.2013.03.008.</p><div>Owens, S. A., K. O. Buesseler, and K. W. W. Sims. "Re-evaluating the 238 U-salinity relationship in seawater: implications for the 238 U-234 Th disequilibrium method." Marine Chemistry 127.1 (2011): 31-39.</div>

<p>Th isotope concentrations are derived from measured Th-232/Th-229 and Th-230/Th-229 ratios as determined by mass spectrometry. The Th-229 spike at MIT was calibrated against a gravimetric Th standard as well as an artificial seawater standard called SWSTD 2010-1, described by Anderson et al. (2012).&nbsp; Corrections for ingrowth of Th-230 from dissolved U-234 during sample storage were made based on measured salinity and the U-salinity relationship of Owens et al. (2011).</p><p>The dissolved “excess” Th-230 (Th_230_D_XS) is derived by subtracting from the measured dissolved Th-230 the component sourced from the partial dissolution of lithogenic material based on measured dissolved Th-232 and a lithogenic Th-230/232 atom ratio of 4 x 10<sup>-6</sup>, as described by Hayes et al. (2013).</p><p><strong>BCO-DMO Processing:</strong><br />- added conventional header with dataset name, PI name, version date<br />- renamed parameters to BCO-DMO standard<br />- changed longitude from positive to negative values</p><p>Cruise AE1410 was supported by UNOLS and NSF. The sample analysis was supported by the W.O. Crosby post-doctoral fellowship from MIT to Christopher Hayes.</p>

gmd:organisationName.gmx:Anchor: Biological and Chemical Oceanography Data Management Office (BCO-DMO)

gmd:contactInstructions.gco:CharacterString: For questions regarding this resource, please contact BCO-DMO via the email address provided.

gmi:description.gco:CharacterString: PI Supplied Instrument Name: PI Supplied Instrument Description:5-L Go-Flo bottle, attached to the ship’s Kevlar line Instrument Name: GO-FLO Bottle Instrument Short Name:GO-FLO Instrument Description: GO-FLO bottle cast used to collect water samples for pigment, nutrient, plankton, etc. The GO-FLO sampling bottle is specially designed to avoid sample contamination at the surface, internal spring contamination, loss of sample on deck (internal seals), and exchange of water from different depths. Community Standard Description: http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/L05/current/30/

PI Supplied Instrument Name: PI Supplied Instrument Description:ship’s CTD with conventional Niskin bottles Instrument Name: Niskin bottle Instrument Short Name:Niskin bottle Instrument Description: A Niskin bottle (a next generation water sampler based on the Nansen bottle) is a cylindrical, non-metallic water collection device with stoppers at both ends. The bottles can be attached individually on a hydrowire or deployed in 12, 24 or 36 bottle Rosette systems mounted on a frame and combined with a CTD. Niskin bottles are used to collect discrete water samples for a range of measurements including pigments, nutrients, plankton, etc. Community Standard Description: http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/L22/current/TOOL0412/

PI Supplied Instrument Name: PI Supplied Instrument Description:Tisch Environmental PM10 aerosol sampler (TE-6070), using 20 cm x 25 cm Whatman41 filter sheets. Instrument Name: Aerosol Sampler Instrument Short Name:Aerosol_Sampler Instrument Description: A device that collects a sample of aerosol (dry particles or liquid droplets) from the atmosphere. Community Standard Description: http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/L05/current/13/

PI Supplied Instrument Name: PI Supplied Instrument Description:MITESS unit Instrument Name: Trace element sampler Instrument Short Name: Instrument Description: Automated trace element sampler (MITESS or ATE unit).Bell, J., J. Betts, and E. Boyle (2002) MITESS: A Moored In-situ Trace Element Serial Sampler for Deep-Sea Moorings, Deep-Sea Research I: 49:2103-2118 (pdf)More description: http://boyle.mit.edu/~ed/MITESS/MITESShomepage.html

gmd:title.gmx:Anchor: International Council for the Exploration of the Sea
